heading: daimlerchrysler
subheading: the minivan and the luxury sedan, side by side: analysts say the industry will never be the same, not after germany's daimler-benz completes its acquisition of chrysler corp., the no. 3 us automaker. the us$38 billion stock swap was approved wednesday by the directors of each company, and was expected to be formally announced today. the new daimlerchrysler will be jointly run for perhaps three years, but daimler-benz chief executive juergen schrempp is expected to gain control thereafter.
author: wired staff
